info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 2:42AM MDT by NWS Great Falls MT
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Great Falls MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following creek in Montana...
Clear Creek at Chinook affecting Blaine County.
* WHAT...Heavy rainfall from earlier thunderstorms has resulted in a rapid rise of water levels on Creek Creek in Blaine county. Moderate flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Clear Creek at Chinook.
* WHEN...From early this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Machinist Road may not be passable and Clear Creek Road may be covered by water in several locations. At 8.0 feet, water may be 2 to 3 feet deep in corrals along Clear Creek.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM MDT Monday the stage was 7.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 AM MDT Monday was 7.6 feet. - Forecast...Some additional rises are possible early this morning before levels quickly recede. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.1 feet on 04/09/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 245 PM MDT.
